description: This schema defines the structure of the IATI project location standard, enriched with the full Location Types List Proposal metadata. It is used to validate the project location data provided by the project counterparts.

f_id.description: For new locations, this column is empty. For updates, your project counterpart will provide you with a list of unique field ID numbers in this file to ensure that updated location IDs match with the former ones.

donor_project_no.description: Every project location in the IATI Project Location Standard must be assigned to its respective (IATI) donor project number, which is provided by the respective partner, donor or implementing agency.

project_acronym.description: Please enter the acronym used for the name/title of the project to be visible on your map.

data_provider.description: Legal entity that provided the data here (= legal authorship).

publishing_restrictions.description: Indicates if this information is collected in fragile regions and should therefore be omitted from publicly available reports.

date_of_data_collection.description: Date of data collection or latest update. In case only the year is available please choose the 1st of January i.e. YYYY-01-01

related_community.description: You may enter a village, hamlet, or neighborhood name that relates to this location. This can serve to manually add smaller community or administrative unit names not identified in existing global databases.

location_name.description: Unique name of the project site and its (main) activity incl local MIS-/GIS-ID, if availabe. This will be used as reference for line and polygon data.

location_activity_status.description: The activity status at the location according to the IATI standard.

activity_start_date.description: Approximate planned or actual start date of activities on the ground.

activity_end_date.description: Approximate planned or actual end date of implementation of activities on the ground.

activity_description.description: A short description of the main project activity in this location.

enum: certified sustainable aquaculture or fisheries (MSC, ASC)
area covered by off-grid renewable energy
area covered by on-grid renewable energy
cadastre / land management / tenure system / area
rail operation control system / intelligent transport system (ITS)
natural monument or feature (IUCN Cat III)
habitat or species management area (IUCN Cat IV)
protected landscape or seascape (IUCN Cat V)
protected area with sustainable use of natural resources (IUCN Cat VI)
key biodiversity area (KBA) with financed management
buffer zone around a protected or sensitive area
biodiversity offset / compensation area incl. PFES
certified sustainable forest management (FSC, Rainforest Alliance, PEFC)
harvesting sites for NTFPs and other biodiversity products

geographic_exactness.description: Please use 'exact' if the end destination of a financial flow is geographically known, and it is not an administrative unit, and if you do not face security restrictions to do so. Otherwise, please choose 'approximate (yet unknown)', 'approximate (security)', or 'approximate (admin unit)'

title: IATI Project Location Standard

location_types_reference.name: building(s)
location_types_reference.description: a structure built for permanent use, as a house, factory, etc.

location_types_reference.name: common / public space(s)
location_types_reference.description: an area, park or pasture for community use

location_types_reference.name: equipment / materials
location_types_reference.description: movable items and resources used for specific activities, services, or operations

location_types_reference.name: facility
location_types_reference.description: a building or buildings housing a center, institute, foundation, hospital, prison, mission, courthouse, etc.

location_types_reference.name: factory
location_types_reference.description: one or more buildings where goods are manufactured, processed or fabricated

location_types_reference.name: housing (development)
location_types_reference.description: a tract of land on which many houses of similar design are built according to a development plan

location_types_reference.name: hub / cluster / incubator
location_types_reference.description: a facility or location supporting innovation, collaboration, or business development

location_types_reference.name: ICT-infrastructure / ICT-equipment
location_types_reference.description: hardware and related materials and infrastructure required for information and communication technology operations

location_types_reference.name: micro, small & medium enterprises (MSME)
location_types_reference.description: sites where micro, small and medium-sized enterprises are located

location_types_reference.name: ministry
location_types_reference.description: government building where a ministry is located, serving administrative and policy functions

location_types_reference.name: museum
location_types_reference.description: a building where objects of permanent interest in one or more of the arts and sciences are preserved and exhibited

location_types_reference.name: office building
location_types_reference.description: office building where public or business services are conducted

location_types_reference.name: other physical
location_types_reference.description: physical location not fitting any existing available location type in this repository

location_types_reference.name: other immaterial
location_types_reference.description: type of intervention that has no physical location, only a target area, and which is not fitting any other available immaterial location type in this repository

location_types_reference.name: rehabilitation / reconstruction
location_types_reference.description: site or area where infrastructure or facilities are rehabiltated, restored or rebuilt

location_types_reference.name: research institute / facility
location_types_reference.description: a facility where research is carried out

location_types_reference.name: advisory facility / support
location_types_reference.description: a facility or location where advisory support services are being provided

location_types_reference.name: capacity development / training
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of interventions that are enhancing capacities, abilities, knowledge or skills for personal, professional or organizational growth

location_types_reference.name: civil society support
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of mechanisms or environments fostering public engagement and strengthening community-based and other civil society organizations

location_types_reference.name: digital services usage area
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of interventions that promote the use of digital services, apps or online resources

location_types_reference.name: early warning system
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of mechanisms and services enabling timely information delivery for anticipating and mitigating critical events such as disasters and pandemics

location_types_reference.name: environmental & social mgt system
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of mechanisms and procedures to assess, analyse, manage and mitigate ecological and social aspects within projects or organizations

location_types_reference.name: income generating activities (IGA)
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of interventions that Initiatives aimed at increasing economic resources through productive means.

location_types_reference.name: insurance (other)
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of insurance services that are not climate risk insurance and that are designed to provide protection against specific risks or uncertainties

location_types_reference.name: matching grants distribution area
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of financial contributions based on co-funding principles

location_types_reference.name: political / institutional reforms (PBF / PBL)
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of processes that advance changes in governance frameworks or organizational structures

location_types_reference.name: public / social dialogue
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of mechanisms that encourage public exchanges between stakeholders for collective decision-making

location_types_reference.name: saving groups / VSLA / SACCOs support
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of interventions or mechanisms that facilitate community-based financial cooperation and resource pooling such as village-based savings and loans associations (VSLA) or savings and credit cooperative organizations (SACCOs)

location_types_reference.name: sensitization / awareness raising (campaign)
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of campaigns or other communication activities intended to inform, mobilize or educate targeted audiences on specific topics

location_types_reference.name: supply chains (support) area
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of systems or services to increase the value generated locally or to make supply chains more efficient

location_types_reference.name: voucher(s) (system) distributrion area
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of interventions for allocating entitlements or credits to beneficiaries through organized schemes

location_types_reference.name: slaugtherhouse
location_types_reference.description: facility where animals are killed and processed for food production

location_types_reference.name: mine(s)
location_types_reference.description: a site where mineral ores are extracted from the ground by excavating surface pits and subterranean passages

location_types_reference.name: workshop(s)
location_types_reference.description: a building dedicated to hands-on activities, technical work, or small-scale manufacturing

location_types_reference.name: sustainably farmed area(s)
location_types_reference.description: an non-irrigated farm area under ecologically sustainable cultivation

location_types_reference.name: cultivated area
location_types_reference.description: an area under cultivation (non-irrigated, no focus on ecological sustainability)

location_types_reference.name: garden(s)
location_types_reference.description: an enclosure for displaying selected plant or animal life

location_types_reference.name: grazing / rangeland (management) area
location_types_reference.description: a (managed rangeland) area of grasses and shrubs used for grazing

location_types_reference.name: improved soil / erosion control area
location_types_reference.description: intervention area for soil improvement or erosion mitigation

location_types_reference.name: irrigated field(s)
location_types_reference.description: a tract of level or terraced land which is irrigated

location_types_reference.name: irrigation infrastructure
location_types_reference.description: constructions including headwork and equipment for distributing water to agricultural land

location_types_reference.name: nursery(-ies) / seed bank
location_types_reference.description: a place where plants and / or trees and / or their seeds are propagated for transplanting or grafting

location_types_reference.name: food processing & value addition
location_types_reference.description: facility where crops or livestock products are processed and enhanced

location_types_reference.name: restored / rehabilitated land area
location_types_reference.description: area where degraded land has been recovered for productive or ecological use

location_types_reference.name: weir(s)
location_types_reference.description: a small dam in a stream, designed to raise the water level or to divert stream flow through a desired channel

location_types_reference.name: agricultural extension services
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of services that transfer expertise and innovations to people engaged in agriculture

location_types_reference.name: contract farming / PPP
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of interventions that facilitate collaboration between producers and buyers for mutual benefit

location_types_reference.name: farmers groups / cooperatives support
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of interventions or entities strengthening collective efforts among agricultural producers

location_types_reference.name: agroforestry area
location_types_reference.description: area under agro-sylviculture or forest farming land use management that integrates trees with crops or pasture and combines agricultural and forestry technologies

location_types_reference.name: aquaculture
location_types_reference.description: site for controlled cultivation ("aquafarming") of aquatic organisms such as fish, crustaceans, mollusks, algae and aquatic plants

location_types_reference.name: fisheries management area
location_types_reference.description: designated zone for the management and regulation of fishery activities

location_types_reference.name: certified sustainable aquaculture or fisheries (MSC, ASC)
location_types_reference.description: aquaculture production sites verified for compliance with environmental and ethical standards in aquatic food provisioning

location_types_reference.name: coastguard station
location_types_reference.description: building where maritime safety operations and surveillance are managed and coordinated

location_types_reference.name: FAO catch-area
location_types_reference.description: geographic divisions of the oceans and seas defined by the FAO from where the caught fish originate and that are one of the basic requirements to ensure the traceability of fish products

location_types_reference.name: feed-mill
location_types_reference.description: processing facility for producing fish or other animal feed from raw agricultural products

location_types_reference.name: inland waters fishery
location_types_reference.description: inland water ecosystem for harvesting aquatic species from non-marine ecosystems

location_types_reference.name: pond
location_types_reference.description: a small standing waterbody

location_types_reference.name: small scale fisheries (SSF) zone
location_types_reference.description: exclusive coast and inshore water zones under artisanal stewardship by small-scale fishers communities

location_types_reference.name: school (primary, secondary, college)
location_types_reference.description: building(s) where primary, secondary or college instruction in one or more branches of knowledge takes place

location_types_reference.name: TVET school / infrastructure
location_types_reference.description: building or facility for technical and vocational education and training

location_types_reference.name: university
location_types_reference.description: institution for higher education and academic research

location_types_reference.name: scholarship program area
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of scholarship programs support

location_types_reference.name: area covered by off-grid renewable energy
location_types_reference.description: area powered by renewable energy sources, independently from central electrical networks / grids, for example local photovoltaic or hydropower grids or solar panels

location_types_reference.name: area covered by on-grid renewable energy
location_types_reference.description: area powered by renewable energy through central electrical networks / grids from public utility infrastructure

location_types_reference.name: biogas plant
location_types_reference.description: building or facility where organic matter is converted into renewable energy through biological processes

location_types_reference.name: electric power transmission & distribution (T&D)
location_types_reference.description: power line facilitating the movement of electrical energy between locations

location_types_reference.name: electric substation
location_types_reference.description: part of an electrical generation, transmission, and distribution system for transforming, switching, or control of electrical current within the grid

location_types_reference.name: energy efficiency measure(s)
location_types_reference.description: site of interventions focusing on the minimization of energy consumption

location_types_reference.name: geothermal power plant
location_types_reference.description: building or facility where thermal energy derived from beneath the earth is harnessed for power generation

location_types_reference.name: hydrogen plant
location_types_reference.description: building or facility dedicated to the production and storage of hydrogen for energy or industrial use

location_types_reference.name: hydropower plant / dam
location_types_reference.description: a building where electricity is generated from water power

location_types_reference.name: solar power plant
location_types_reference.description: a building or facility where electricity is generated from photovoltaic power

location_types_reference.name: wind power plant
location_types_reference.description: facility where electricity is generated from wind energy

location_types_reference.name: district heating area / distribution
location_types_reference.description: area served by a centralized heat supply system

location_types_reference.name: battery energy storage system (BESS)
location_types_reference.description: facility storing electricity for later use via battery technology

location_types_reference.name: fuel station
location_types_reference.description: place where fuel for vehicles and machinery is dispensed

location_types_reference.name: charging station
location_types_reference.description: place providing charging services for electric vehicles

location_types_reference.name: power station (other)
location_types_reference.description: a building or facility for generating electric power by other means than solar, wind or hydropower

location_types_reference.name: bank
location_types_reference.description: an establishment for the custody, loan, exchange or issue of money, for the extension of credit, and for facilitating the transmission of funds

location_types_reference.name: banking branch / outlet
location_types_reference.description: a building where banking services are provided

location_types_reference.name: company
location_types_reference.description: main building or office of a business entity

location_types_reference.name: credit guarantee fund
location_types_reference.description: facility or entity managing guarantees for loan repayment

location_types_reference.name: financial institution
location_types_reference.description: main building or office of a business / banking entity that provides service as an intermediary for different types of financial monetary transactions

location_types_reference.name: fonds manager headquarter
location_types_reference.description: main office / building of a fund management entity

location_types_reference.name: free trade zone
location_types_reference.description: an area, usually a section of a port, where goods may be received and shipped free of customs duty and of most customs regulations

location_types_reference.name: industrial area / zone
location_types_reference.description: an area characterized by industrial activity

location_types_reference.name: microfinance institution (MFI)
location_types_reference.description: main office / building of an institution providing microfinance services

location_types_reference.name: bonds
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually the country-level admin unit, of tradable financial assets serving as instruments for raising or lending capital

location_types_reference.name: guarantees
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of financial instruments for the transfer of risk

location_types_reference.name: loans
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of financial debt instruments for temporarily transferring funds to borrowers

location_types_reference.name: subordinated loans
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of financial debt instruments for temporarily transferring funds to borrowers that have a lower repayment priority in comparison to other credits

location_types_reference.name: ICT infrastructure (broadband / connectivity)
location_types_reference.description: cable installations enabling high-speed digital communication

location_types_reference.name: ICT infrastructure (data center)
location_types_reference.description: a building hosting servers and other hardware and equipment for secure storage and processing of information

location_types_reference.name: (communal) public infrastructure
location_types_reference.description: target area covering buildings and other installations and assets serving collective purposes within communities

location_types_reference.name: citizen service center
location_types_reference.description: a building where administrative processes and public services for local residents are provided

location_types_reference.name: customs office
location_types_reference.description: a building where customs and duties are paid on goods

location_types_reference.name: fire station
location_types_reference.description: building housing firefighters and/or fire fighting equipment

location_types_reference.name: media support
location_types_reference.description: building or site where information dissemination and public outreach are supported

location_types_reference.name: public (admin) training institute
location_types_reference.description: a building of an institution dedicated to advancing administrative skils and competencies in the public sector

location_types_reference.name: violence prevention
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of interventions aiming to reduce risk or incidence of conflict and harm in society

location_types_reference.name: cadastre / land management / tenure system / area
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of systems for documenting, managing, and regulating land and/or property ownership, possession, tenure, use and other rights, restrictions and responsibilites including parcel-based cadastre systems

location_types_reference.name: citizen participation / feedback (system)
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of mechanisms fostering citizens' involvement or inputs in decisions on public services, infrastructure, governance and policy-making

location_types_reference.name: decentralisation support & communal development
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of interventions supporting geographical distribution of authority and capacity-strengthening at local levels

location_types_reference.name: democratization support
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of processes encouraging responsive and inclusive public governance frameworks and processes

location_types_reference.name: digital transformation of public services
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of interventions to improve interactions between public authorities and citizens or the private sector using digital technologies

location_types_reference.name: domestic revenue mobilization
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of interventions facilitating improved collection and administration of public funds

location_types_reference.name: intergovernmental fiscal transfer mechanism
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of interventions guiding redistribution of resources among governmental entities

location_types_reference.name: public financial management (PFM)
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of systems and practices ensuring efficient allocation and oversight of public funds

location_types_reference.name: clinic
location_types_reference.description: a medical facility associated with a hospital for outpatients

location_types_reference.name: dispensary
location_types_reference.description: a building where medical or dental aid is dispensed

location_types_reference.name: health post
location_types_reference.description: a small medical facility providing basic health services

location_types_reference.name: hospital
location_types_reference.description: a building in which sick or injured, especially those confined to bed, are medically treated

location_types_reference.name: laboratory
location_types_reference.description: facility for scientific, medical, or diagnostic analysis

location_types_reference.name: medical isolation station
location_types_reference.description: facility for isolating patients to prevent disease spread

location_types_reference.name: medical products development
location_types_reference.description: building or site dedicated to research and development of medical products

location_types_reference.name: distribution of medical products / contraceptives
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of distribution of medical products / contraceptives incl. vaccines

location_types_reference.name: social franchising / NGO clinics
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of NGOs and social franchised businesses offering subsidized products and services that people need - such as healthcare, water, sanitation, energy, and education

location_types_reference.name: social marketing
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of interventions promoting health-related products, services or behaviors

location_types_reference.name: airplane(s)
location_types_reference.description: main location for airplanes parking, storage and maintenance

location_types_reference.name: airport
location_types_reference.description: a place where aircraft regularly land and take off, with runways, navigational aids, and major facilities for the commercial handling of passengers and cargo

location_types_reference.name: aviation safety system / flight control
location_types_reference.description: main site of technical installations overseeing the secure movement of aircraft within airspace

location_types_reference.name: boat(s) / ship(s) / -yard
location_types_reference.description: a boatyard, also called a shipyard or dockyard is a place where boats or ships are built and repaired or another location of boats / ships

location_types_reference.name: bridge
location_types_reference.description: a structure erected across an obstacle such as a stream, road, etc., in order to carry roads, railroads, and pedestrians across

location_types_reference.name: bus rapid transit (BRT) / bus system
location_types_reference.description: area covered by a high-capacity bus-based transit system that delivers fast, reliable, high-quality, safe, and cost-effective services

location_types_reference.name: buses
location_types_reference.description: main location for bus parking, storage and maintenance

location_types_reference.name: rolling stock
location_types_reference.description: main location for parking, storage and maintenance of powered and unpowered railway vehicles, for example, trains, locomotives, electric / diesel multiple units (DMU/EMU), freight and passenger waggons, cars or coaches

location_types_reference.name: ferry (line, system)
location_types_reference.description: water routes track or system for transporting people and / or vehicles

location_types_reference.name: intraurban rail infrastructure
location_types_reference.description: intraurban light rail transit system: right rail, subway, metro, tramway

location_types_reference.name: interurban rail infrastructure
location_types_reference.description: interurban heavy rail system

location_types_reference.name: highway
location_types_reference.description: major road connecting regions, intended for vehicle traffic

location_types_reference.name: depot / marshalling yard
location_types_reference.description: facility for parking, storing, maintaining, and routing railway vehicles and other rolling stock

location_types_reference.name: other road-based vehicles
location_types_reference.description: site for parking or storage of vehicles other than buses, trains, and ships

location_types_reference.name: pedestrian lane(s) / bike lane(s)
location_types_reference.description: dedicated pathways designed for non-motorized movement and activity of pedestrians and / or cyclists

location_types_reference.name: port
location_types_reference.description: a place provided with terminal and transfer facilities for loading and discharging waterborne cargo or passengers, usually located in a harbor

location_types_reference.name: rail operation control system / intelligent transport system (ITS)
location_types_reference.description: location of a traffic and / or mobility management system for road transport, including infrastructure, vehicles and users, as well as for interfaces with other modes of transport

location_types_reference.name: railroad station
location_types_reference.description: a railroad, railway or train station is a facility comprising ticket office, platforms, tracks etc. for loading and unloading train passengers and freight incl. intermodal passenger hub

location_types_reference.name: railroad
location_types_reference.description: a permanent twin steel-rail track on which freight and passenger cars move long distances

location_types_reference.name: road
location_types_reference.description: an open way with improved surface for transportation of animals, people and vehicles

location_types_reference.name: traffic management center / IST
location_types_reference.description: traffic management center / intelligent transport system (ITS)

location_types_reference.name: (multimodal) logistic node / warehouse
location_types_reference.description: a building for storing goods, especially provisions

location_types_reference.name: waterway(s) (system)
location_types_reference.description: area or network of natural or engineered channels facilitating the movement of waterborne traffic

location_types_reference.name: bus station / terminal
location_types_reference.description: bus station and / or (intermodal) passenger hub containing a parking area for cars or large trucks

location_types_reference.name: camp(s)
location_types_reference.description: a site occupied by tents, huts, or other shelters for temporary use

location_types_reference.name: emergency supplies distribution area
location_types_reference.description: organized space for allocating aid materials and resources in crisis situations

location_types_reference.name: food access point
location_types_reference.description: organized space where food is distributed to individuals, families or other groups

location_types_reference.name: internally displaced persons (IDP) camp
location_types_reference.description: a camp used by people affected by domestic disasters, conflict or other internal migration pressures

location_types_reference.name: refugee camp
location_types_reference.description: a camp used by refugees

location_types_reference.name: community policing
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of interventions building trust and security among residents through collaborative safety measures

location_types_reference.name: disarmament, demobilisation, reintegration of combatants (DDR)
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of interventions aiding former combatants in returning to civilian life and fostering stability

location_types_reference.name: election support
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of services and systems facilitating the proper conduct and oversight of electoral processes

location_types_reference.name: reparation payments
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of delivering compensatory resources to affected individuals or groups

location_types_reference.name: child protection services
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of interventions safeguarding minors from abuse, neglect, or exploitation

location_types_reference.name: women's shelter / GBV support
location_types_reference.description: safe building or encampment providing assistance for women and girls facing gender-based violence or other types of insecurity

location_types_reference.name: basic social services
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of services that ensure minimum standards of health, education, and/or wellbeing for the public

location_types_reference.name: cash- / food-for-work
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of schemes exchanging remuneration or food provisions for productive activities

location_types_reference.name: cash transfers
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of arrangements distributing monetary benefits directly to eligible recipients

location_types_reference.name: climate risk insurance
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of insurance services addressing financial impacts of risks arising from extreme weather events that are increasing in frequency and intensity because of climate change

location_types_reference.name: social protection system
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of integrated policies and support systems designed to reduce vulnerability and poverty

location_types_reference.name: employment subsidies
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of financial incentives promoting job creation and / or workforce increase

location_types_reference.name: strict nature reserve (IUCN Cat Ia)
location_types_reference.description: area which is protected from all but light human use in order to protect its biodiversity and also possibly its geological / geomorphological features

location_types_reference.name: wilderness area (IUCN Cat Ib)
location_types_reference.description: a protected domain in which biodiversity and ecosystem processes (including evolution) are allowed to flourish or experience restoration if previously disturbed by human activity

location_types_reference.name: national park (IUCN Cat II)
location_types_reference.description: area managed in a way that may contribute to local economies through promoting educational and recreational tourism on a scale that will not reduce the effectiveness of conservation efforts

location_types_reference.name: natural monument or feature (IUCN Cat III)
location_types_reference.description: a smaller area or site that is specifically allocated to protect a natural monument and its surrounding habitats

location_types_reference.name: habitat or species management area (IUCN Cat IV)
location_types_reference.description: area focusing on the maintenance, conservation, and restoration of particular species and habitats, possibly through traditional means, and public education

location_types_reference.name: protected landscape or seascape (IUCN Cat V)
location_types_reference.description: a body of land or ocean with an explicit natural conservation plan, but usually also accommodating a range of for-profit activities

location_types_reference.name: protected area with sustainable use of natural resources (IUCN Cat VI)
location_types_reference.description: vast area that already has a low level of human occupation or in which local communities and their traditional practices have had little permanent impact on the environmental health

location_types_reference.name: other effective area-based conservation measures (OECM)
location_types_reference.description: sites outside of protected areas that are governed and managed in ways that deliver the long-term in situ conservation of biodiversity

location_types_reference.name: indigenous & community conservation area (ICCA)
location_types_reference.description: specific areas (territories of life) being actively conserved by indigenous peoples and local communities, i.e., natural spaces de facto governed by Indigenous peoples or local communities that could include collective commons, areas and territories of self-defined, peer-reviewed communities, other than ITTs

location_types_reference.name: indigenous and traditional territories (ITT)
location_types_reference.description: territories traditionally inhabited, used, governed, and managed by the indigenous people and local communities

location_types_reference.name: wildlife management area / game reserve
location_types_reference.description: area supporting the safe coexistence and managed utilization of wild animal populations

location_types_reference.name: marine protected area (MPA)
location_types_reference.description: a protected area of the world's seas, oceans, or estuaries designated to preserve habitats and marine species, except no-take zones

location_types_reference.name: locally managed marine areas (LMMA)
location_types_reference.description: areas of the world's seas, oceans, or estuaries overseen by local community groups to maintain marine ecosystems and resources

location_types_reference.name: private protected area / conservation easement
location_types_reference.description: area conserved through private stewardship arrangements or contractual agreements

location_types_reference.name: exclusive economic zone (EEZ)
location_types_reference.description: area of the sea in which a sovereign state has exclusive rights regarding the exploration and use of marine resources, including energy production from water and wind

location_types_reference.name: indigenous peoples & local communities (IP&LC)
location_types_reference.description: areas managed or influenced by distinct and diverse indigenous groups and communities that maintain close ties to their territories and traditions, playing a crucial role in environmental management

location_types_reference.name: no-take zone
location_types_reference.description: a marine protected area (MPA) permanently set aside from direct human disturbance, where all methods of fishing and extraction of natural materials, dumping, dredging or construction activities are prohibited

location_types_reference.name: visitor center / education facility
location_types_reference.description: building(s) for learning, outreach, and engagement regarding natural environments

location_types_reference.name: regeneration / restoration / rehabilition area
location_types_reference.description: land area dedicated to protecting, enhancing or restoring ecological health and functions of natural environments including forests

location_types_reference.name: watershed / catchment conservation area
location_types_reference.description: land area that safeguards the natural flow and quality of freshwater resources

location_types_reference.name: fire management area
location_types_reference.description: vegetation area where fire management measures are being carried out

location_types_reference.name: key biodiversity area (KBA) with financed management
location_types_reference.description: areas that contribute significantly to the global persistence of biodiversity in terrestrial, freshwater and marine environments with secured funding for management

location_types_reference.name: buffer zone around a protected or sensitive area
location_types_reference.description: buffer zone around a protected area or sensitive site

location_types_reference.name: invasive species management area
location_types_reference.description: target area of interventions reducing or eliminating detrimental non-native organisms

location_types_reference.name: ranger station / field base
location_types_reference.description: a collection of buildings and facilities (field base) for carrying out range and forest management

location_types_reference.name: re- / afforestation area
location_types_reference.description: area designated for planting and fostering new tree vegetation to boost ecological value

location_types_reference.name: biodiversity offset / compensation area incl. PFES
location_types_reference.description: area where ecological compensation measures are implemented to fully compensate for biodiversity impacts associated with economic development, through the planning process

location_types_reference.name: certified sustainable forest management (FSC, Rainforest Alliance, PEFC)
location_types_reference.description: area covered by a certification system to ensure environmentally responsible, socially beneficial and economically viable management of forests

location_types_reference.name: ecological corridor / connectivity area
location_types_reference.description: areas managed to restore effective biological connectivity between larger ecosystems promoting movement and interaction among wildlife populations

location_types_reference.name: monitoring and research sites
location_types_reference.description: biodiversity observation area

location_types_reference.name: harvesting sites for NTFPs and other biodiversity products
location_types_reference.description: an area dominated by trees where non-timber forest products and other biodiversity products are being harvested

location_types_reference.name: (urban) street
location_types_reference.description: a paved urban thoroughfare

location_types_reference.name: city district / urban development
location_types_reference.description: area characterized by a concentration of residential, commercial, and public facilities and high population density, managed for organized growth and improved living standards

location_types_reference.name: market (shopping area)
location_types_reference.description: a place where goods are bought and sold at regular intervals

location_types_reference.name: parcs & other green areas
location_types_reference.description: publicly accessibles areas covered by vegetation, designated to provide recreational opportunities, support urban biodiversity, or enhance environmental quality within built environments

location_types_reference.name: shopping center or mall
location_types_reference.description: an urban shopping area featuring a variety of shops surrounding a usually open-air concourse reserved for pedestrian traffic; or a large suburban building or group of buildings containing various shops with associated passageways

location_types_reference.name: slum upgrading
location_types_reference.description: neglected urban zone of high population density undergoing improvements to physical infrastructure and living conditions

location_types_reference.name: street lighting
location_types_reference.description: linear arrangement of installed electric light units enhancing visibility and safety along pathways, streets and roads

location_types_reference.name: recycling facility
location_types_reference.description: facility where materials are processed for re-use instead of disposal

location_types_reference.name: improved waste collection
location_types_reference.description: area benefiting from advanced practices for gathering and handling garbage

location_types_reference.name: landfill
location_types_reference.description: a place for trash and garbage disposal in which the waste is buried between layers of earth to build up low-lying land

location_types_reference.name: landfill gas capture and treatment
location_types_reference.description: facility for capturing and processing emissions from decomposition within waste repositories

location_types_reference.name: mechanical-biological treatment plant
location_types_reference.description: facility relying on a combination of physical and biological processes to treat waste

location_types_reference.name: other waste treatment plants
location_types_reference.description: composting plant, fermentation plant, waste sorting plant and other waste treatment plants

location_types_reference.name: transfer station
location_types_reference.description: intermediate facility consolidating waste for onward transport or disposal

location_types_reference.name: waste-to-energy plant
location_types_reference.description: facility converting solid waste material into usable forms of energy

location_types_reference.name: water pump
location_types_reference.description: a facility for pumping water from a well or through a pipeline

location_types_reference.name: desalination plant
location_types_reference.description: facility for separating drinking water from saline sources

location_types_reference.name: dezentralized sanitation (area)
location_types_reference.description: service area covering distributed solutions for the treatment of wastewater on-site

location_types_reference.name: drinking water supply
location_types_reference.description: service area providing populations with potable water for daily use

location_types_reference.name: water pipeline
location_types_reference.description: drinking water transport pipeline, including water outlet / pipeline

location_types_reference.name: drinking water treatment plant (without desalination)
location_types_reference.description: facility utilizing filtration and purification techniques for safe water provision

location_types_reference.name: flood protection
location_types_reference.description: infrastructure or measures designed to reduce risks associated with rising water levels

location_types_reference.name: reservoir(s)
location_types_reference.description: an artificial pond or lake

location_types_reference.name: sanitary facility
location_types_reference.description: facility for use by the general public that includes a toilet and sink and may include a urinal and/or shower

location_types_reference.name: sewage treatment plant
location_types_reference.description: facility for the processing of sewage and/or wastewater

location_types_reference.name: sewer network
location_types_reference.description: underground system channeling liquid waste away from inhabited areas

location_types_reference.name: sludge treatment & disposal
location_types_reference.description: facility for handling semi-solid residues from water treatment

location_types_reference.name: stormwater network / system
location_types_reference.description: arrangement capturing and directing excess rainfall for flood prevention

location_types_reference.name: water intake
location_types_reference.description: point of access for withdrawing freshwater from natural or artificial sources

location_types_reference.name: water re-use
location_types_reference.description: facility for the utilization of treated effluents for secondary applications

location_types_reference.name: water tank
location_types_reference.description: a contained pool or tank of water at, below, or above ground level

location_types_reference.name: well
location_types_reference.description: a cylindrical hole, pit, or tunnel drilled or dug down to a depth from which water, oil, or gas can be pumped or brought to the surface

location_types_reference.name: hydro-meteorological measurement system
location_types_reference.description: target area, usually admin unit, of instruments or a network tracking water cycle dynamics and weather patterns (a.o. wind speed, evaporation, barometric pressure, humidity, particle size)

location_types_reference.name: water resources protection area
location_types_reference.description: area designated to preserve hydrological features and prevent contamination

location_types_reference.name: watercourse
location_types_reference.description: a natural, well-defined channel produced by flowing water, or an artificial channel / canal designed to carry flowing water
